intro: Galatella tripolium, commonly known as the Tripoli milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and related species. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Galatella tripolium is adapted to rocky and coastal habitats, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
